intro: Ayenia palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's ayenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually gray-green, hairy, and adapted to reduce water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered. Ayenia palmeri is often found in rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endemic species in its range.
